translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses
The Chapter with Khattiyas
The Elder Nun Abhirūpanandā’s Verses
“Ninety-one eons ago,

analyzed: vipassī nāma nāyako  uppajji cāru dassanaḥ
translated: the Leader named Vipassī,🔽of beautiful appearance,
the eye of all the world, arose.🔽At that time I was born
in the prosperous, wealthy, great family of Bandhumatī,
beautiful, dear,
and worshipped by the people.
Approaching the Great Hero,🔽Vipassī, the Leader of the World,
having heard the Dhamma, I went for refuge
to that Leader of men.
Being restrained in the precepts,
and after the subduing of the Best of Men,

analyzed: dhātu thūpassa upari  sa uṇṇa chattam apūjayi
translated: on top of the relic shrine,🔽I worshipped with a golden parasol.
Generous, virtuous,
after passing away from there,
having given up the human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.🔽Then, having excelled

analyzed: adhibhotvāna sesake  rūpa saddehi gandhehi  rasehi phusanehi ca
translated: in ten respects over the others,🔽in beauty, sound, smell,🔽taste, and touch,
in lifespan, complexion,
happiness, and fame,
and likewise in lordship,
I shone.
And in my last existence now,
I was born in Kapilavatthu,
The daughter of Khemaka the Sakyan,
I was well known as Nandā.
I had the perfect beauty,
which was a sign of my radiance;
When I had reached youth,
I was adorned with the beauty of my youth.🔽Then there was a great dispute
among the Sakyans for my sake;
Then my father had me go forth,
so that the Sakyans would not be destroyed.
Having gone forth to the Realised One,
the supreme teacher of the world,
I did not go to him after hearing,
because I was overcome by my own beauty.
I did not go to the instruction,
because I was afraid of seeing the Buddha;
Then the Victorious One by a means,

analyzed: upanetvā sa santika  tissa itthiyaḥ nidassesi
translated: brought me into his presence.🔽The one skilled in the path by his psychic power,
showed me three women:
One like a celestial nymph,
one young, one dead and decrepit.
Having seen the three, I was greatly alarmed,
and I was disgusted with the body, which is a receptacle of impurity;
I stood there, having lost interest in worldly existence,

original: tadā maṁ āha nāyako.🔽‘Āturaṁ asuciṁ pūtiṁ,
analyzed: tadā mam āha nāyako  āturam asucim pūti
translated: then the Leader said to me:
‘See this body, Nandā, which is diseased, impure, and foul,
which is oozing and trickling,
and is delightful to fools.
Develop the mind towards foulness,

analyzed: ekaggam su samāhita  yathā idam tathā eta
translated: One-pointed, well concentrated,🔽Just as this is, so is that;
Just as that is, so is this.
Contemplating thus,
I was diligent, not lazy,
Then, with my own wisdom
I penetrated and crossed over.
Through my diligence
and careful consideration,
I saw this body
as it really is, inside and out.
Then I became disenchanted with the body
and was detached internally.
Through diligence, dispassion, and freedom

analyzed: upasantāmhi nibbutā  iddhīsu ca vasī homi
translated: I was peaceful and attained Nibbāna.🔽I have mastery over spiritual powers
and the divine ear.
I have mastery over the knowledge
of the minds of others, great sage.
I know about past lives
and have purified the divine eye.
All the pollutants are destroyed;

analyzed: na atthi dāni punabbhavaḥ  attha dhamma niruttīsu
translated: there is no more renewed existence.🔽In the meaning, the Teaching, and the language,
and in ready speech,
knowledge arose in me, great hero,
in your presence.
My defilements were burned up,
I live undefiled.
Welcome indeed it was for me🔽…
The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”
The four discriminations,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ abhirūpanandā bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam abhirūpanandā bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Teacher’s bidding.”🔽Thus was there related by the Elder Nun Abhirūpanandā
The Story of the Elder Nun Abhirūpanandā is finished.
